title: Communications Minister Anika Wells speaks about the social media ban at Press Club | ABC NEWS
description: Anika Wells MP, Minister for Communications and Minister for Sport, addresses the National Press Club of Australia on the social media ban and the impact of apps on young Australians. YouTube, Facebook, Instagram and Threads, Kick, Reddit, Snapchat, TikTok, Twitch and X (formerly Twitter) are subject to the ban for under-16s which comes into effect on December 10. title: WHO releases new guidelines around weight-loss drugs amid obesity epidemic | The World | ABC NEWS
description: The World Health Organisation has released guidelines recommending GLP-1-type medications as long-term treatments for obesity, issuing a global call to its member states to ensure its management is available, affordable and sustainable universally. Dr Terri-Lynne South, a dietician and chair of the RACGP Obesity Management Group, tells The World how significant this endorsement is to the health sector. description: A farmer who died trying to stop a "treacherous" fire from destroying his family's property in WA's south has been identified as the local town's deputy shire president. title: Business backs the government's AI plan | The Business | ABC NEWS
description: Within the federal government's AI road map, a new data centre plan sets expectations for future investment - including bringing online new renewable power - given forecasts that data centres could make up six percent of all electricity demand within five years. Macquarie Technology Group has just completed the structure of a new AI data centre in north Sydney that it hopes will be operational in late 2026. Chief executive David Tudehope, says he supports the government's national AI plan. #ABCBusiness Subscribe: http://ab.co/1svxLVE  ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. title: Principal allegedly stabbed by staff member at school in Melbourne | ABC NEWS
description: A man has been arrested after a principal was stabbed on school grounds in Melbourne’s southeastern suburb of Keysborough.  The attack prompted a lockdown of Keysborough Secondary College's Acacia campus, as students were forced to barricade themselves inside classrooms and gyms.  Principal Aaron Sykes suffered non-life-threatening injury and is reportedly recovering well in hospital.  The Victorian Principals Association has identified the alleged attacker as a staff member of the school, while the Victorian Department of Education has described the incident as ‘distressing’. title: What new lending rules mean for property prices | ABC News Daily podcast
description: Australian property is now more expensive than ever and soaring mortgage debt has the financial regulator hitting the brakes on risky lending.   But could stopping banks for offering some loans do anything to stop rapid price growth for homes and units?    Today, the ABC’s chief business correspondent Ian Verrender on what’s worrying APRA and the outlook for the housing market.    Featured:    Ian Verrender, ABC chief business correspondent

title: Family of Greg Lynn's late first wife reveals High Country killer's abusive past | ABC NEWS
description: Decades before he murdered an elderly camper in Victoria's High Country, Greg Lynn was accused of terrorising his first wife in the lead up to her unexpected death in 1999. Now – after a suppression order was lifted – her family is speaking exclusively to the ABC to detail the former Jetstar pilot's history of making death threats, as well as his alleged domestic abuse and animal cruelty. And a warning, this story from Elise Kinsella contains distressing details. title: Floods displace more than 1 million people in Indonesia | ABC NEWS
description: More than a million people have been displaced and more than 700 people killed in floods and landslides triggered by Cyclone Senyar.  Sumatran residents are facing severe shortages of supplies as many communities are isolated and roads cut off.  Calls are growing for Indonesian President Prabowo Subianto to declare a state of emergency to allow for better distribution of aid. title: Man arrested after fatal shooting in Brisbane's Beenleigh | ABC NEWS
description: A 20-year-old man is facing police questioning after a 35-year-old man was shot dead in Brisbane’s southern suburb of Beenleigh.  Police launched a pursuit for the man after he allegedly fled Hugh Muntz Park in an allegedly stolen vehicle.  He was later found hiding in bushland on the Gold Coast. title: Bruce Lehrmann loses appeal against failed defamation case ruling | ABC NEWS
description: Bruce Lehrmann has lost his appeal against a Federal Court ruling that found, on the balance of probabilities, he had raped Brittany Higgins in 2019. Last year, Justice Michael Lee found Mr Lehrmann had raped his then-colleague at Parliament House in Canberra. He appealed against this decision in the Federal Court, and the hearings were held in August. title: Pete Hegseth says he 'didn't stick around' for follow-up strike on Venezuelan boat | ABC NEWS
description: US Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth is defending a follow-up strike on a Venezuelan boat on September 2 which killed 11 people, citing the 'fog of war'. Hegseth says he didn't stick around for the second strike on the boat and said that the admiral in charge had "made the right call" in ordering it. The second strike on the boat reportedly killed two survivors who were clinging to the wreckage, according to a Washington Post investigation. title: Australian National University abandons plan to axe School of Music after public pressure | ABC NEWS
description: The Australian National University has abandoned a proposal to absorb its School of Music into a single course after a major community backlash.  The university had planned to merge the school into a broader School of Creative and Cultural Practice as part of cost-saving measures.  The institution will instead set up a new Performance+ Hub, offering one-on-one instrumental and vocal tuition.
